description: Erection of two storey side extension
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The facing materials used in the development to which this permission relates shall match those of the existing building(s) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details are agreed and that Condition 5(Fire Safety Strategy) of planning permission 23/00204/HOU is hereby discharged subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the details hereby approved.

Heritage Impact Assessment - all applications within a Conservation Area must be accompanied by a Heritage Impact Assessment, in line with the National Planning Policy Framework. Please submit this supporting document.
